channel.title: Keisha S Perkins
channel.description: Recent content on Keisha S Perkins

item.title: Using JavaScript Libraries for Game Development
item.description: This talk is about using JavaScript to create games on the HTML5 canvas. Though you won’t create the next Halo, you’ll learn so much about JavaScript and programming as a whole when you create games with it. In this talk, I’ll introduce you to a library that’s perfect for beginners and “non-coders” alike called p5.js. Why JavaScript? JavaScript is everywhere. If you use the internet, you’ve almost certainly encountered JavaScript.

item.title: About
item.description: Keisha S Perkins is a self-taught designer and developer from Baton Rouge, Louisiana. She works for the library by day and codes by night. She was attracted to the front-end because of its melding of problem solving and visual design, as well as its never-ending list of things to learn. Keisha is driven by an eagerness to create, a desire to learn, and a need to teach. Her passions have contributed to her creating curriculum for teaching the youth in her area, of which she is very proud.

item.title: An Introduction to P5.js
item.description: Here are the slides to a talk I did in February of 2018 called "Using JavaScript Libraries for Game Development: An Introduction to P5.js". The talk is meant to show how the p5.js library can be used as a tool for learning JavaScript while having fun making games. The notes to this talk are also available.

item.title: Contact
item.description: If you'd like to contact me, feel free to fill out the form. Your Name Your Email Message Submit

item.title: How One .PSD File Changed My Design Workflow
How One .PSD Transformed My Design Workflow
Logo Design for JJ Pizza (Thirty Logos)
item.description: I created this logo as a #ThirtyLogos exercise. It was pretty fun to try to quickly come up with a logo a day. I wanted to focus on clean, simple lines while also conveying the product being sold.

item.title: Resume
item.description: Professional Experience Coding Instructor The Futures Fund 2017 to Present Instructs weekly class of 10 to 15 middle school students in front-end development. Devised curriculum that is currently being used to teach all Coding Level One students in the program. Designs exercises and activities to better demonstrate techniques involved in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development. Freelance Designer and Developer KayEssPeaDesign 2015 to Present Generates digital and print designs to suit clients’ needs and requirements.

item.title: Thank You!
item.description: Thank you for contacting me! I'll get back to you soon.
